Name: Workforce development plan for small business.
Title: A Local Law in relation to a workforce development plan for small business

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Amended by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Mayor
History.MinutesNote: This bill was heard but not signed at the November 6, 2017 Mayoral Public Hearing on Proposed Local Laws.

History.Description: This Introduction was City Charter Rule Adopted
History.MinutesNote: This bill was returned unsigned on Nov. 17, 2017 (31st Day).

Summary: This bill requires the Commissioner of Small Business Services to create a comprehensive workforce development plan based, to the extent practicable, on the results of the state of small business survey. The plan is due no later than June 1, 2019 and includes: strategies for addressing the hiring needs of small businesses, information on addressing workforce development needs, identifying and addressing issues small businesses experience such as barriers to growth, and information on tools and resources that may assist small businesses.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section 1. Workforce development plan for small businesses. a. No later than June 1, 2019, the commissioner of small business services shall submit to the mayor and the speaker of the council, and post online, a comprehensive workforce development plan informed, to the extent practicable, by the results of the state of small business survey conducted pursuant to a local law of the city of New York for the year 2017 as proposed in introduction number 1511-A. 
	b. Such plan may include, but need not be limited to:
	1. Strategies to address the hiring needs of small businesses;
	2. Information specific to addressing workforce development needs and skills necessary to fill small business jobs; 
	3. Identifying and addressing issues that small businesses are experiencing, such as barriers to growth; and
	4. Information on tools and resources that may assist small businesses.
	� 2. This local law takes effect immediately, and remains in effect until the submission of the plan due June 1, 2019, when it is deemed repealed.

NKA/SSY
LS 9682/9683
9/19/2017 9:30pm
